content:
Has anyone worked with Sansoro health?
https://www.sansorohealth.com/api_list/apis/
(my limited knowledge) but they appear to be reinventing the wheel.
https://www.sansorohealth.com/faqs/#traditional

From the "how is it different to FHIR" I read:

FHIR only defines standards for activity data within the EHR. Emissary provides patent pending Discovery APIs, which gives access to EMR reference tables (i.e. build and configuration) for any third-party applications.

and

Emissary offers a set of real-time APIs in a proprietary unified data model, with greater flexibility and stability.

Looks like they see themselves as a proprietary alternative to FHIR. Good luck with that.
there's a small subset of people who would find that combination of things a better deal and pay $$$ for it....
